title: Kim Kardashian West is pushing for Brendan Dassey to be granted clemency in the 'Making a Murderer' case
text:
Kim Kardashian West is pushing for Brendan Dassey, who was featured on the Netflix docu-series "Making a Murderer," to be granted clemency after spending 13 years in prison.

Dassey was convicted of the 2005 murder of photographer Teresa Halbach alongside his uncle, Steven Avery.

Dassey's legal team issued a plea for clemency on Wednesday, featuring a hand-written letter from Dassey.

On Thursday, Kardashian West, who is a major prison reform advocate, tweeted out the letter, urging Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers to read it.

Kim Kardashian West is pushing for Brendan Dassey, who was featured on the Netflix docu-series "Making a Murderer," to be granted clemency.

Dassey, who was convicted of the 2005 murder of photographer Teresa Halbach alongside his uncle Steven Avery, has served more than 13 years in prison.

The case was first featured on "Making a Murderer" in 2016, and the docu-series sparked criticism over Dassey's confession, which many argued was coerced.

Dassey's legal team issued a plea for clemency on Wednesday, featuring a hand-written letter from Dassey. On Thursday, Kardashian West, who is a major advocate for prison reform, tweeted out the letter, urging Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers to read it.

—Kim Kardashian West (@KimKardashian) October 3, 2019

"I am writing to ask for a pardon because I am innocent and want to go home," Dassey wrote in the letter. "If I would get to go home, I would like to get a job involving video games. I would like to help take care of my mom and one day have a son and a daughter of my own. I would name my daughter Grace and my son Mizar which is the name of a star in the big dipper."

Read more: A Wisconsin prisoner just reportedly confessed to the 'Making a Murderer' killing

Kardashian West also tweeted out a promo for an upcoming interview Dassey is said to be giving on a podcast called "Wrongful Conviction with Jason From."

—Kim Kardashian West (@KimKardashian) October 3, 2019

Dassey was 16 at the time of the 2005 killing, and his lawyers have argued that investigators used improper interviewing techniques when questioning him about Halbach's death, WBAY reported. His lawyers said investigators made Dassey, a then-juvenile with a low IQ, false promises about being released if he spoke about the death.

Both Dassey and Avery have said they're innocent in the years since. Avery is serving a life sentence without parole, while Dassey is serving a life sentence with the possibility of parole.

Kardashian West famously pushed for President Donald Trump to grant clemency to Alice Johnson in 2018. Johnson had been sentenced to life in prison in 1996 on non-violent drug charges. Kardashian West also pushed for Cyntoia Brown to be granted clemency before she was released from prison earlier this year.

Insider has contacted Kardashian West's spokesperson and Dassey's lawyer for comment.
description: Brendan Dassey, who was convicted of the 2005 murder of photographer Teresa Halbach alongside his uncle Steven Avery, has been in prison for 13 years.
